newsitem.title: USA: U.S., Japan to resume insurance talks in Sept.
newsitem.headline: U.S., Japan to resume insurance talks in Sept.

text.p: The United States and Japan have agreed to resume talks in September to try to resolve a dispute over insurance deregulation in Japan, but no date has been set, a U.S. trade official said Wednesday.

The official spoke to reporters following a meeting between U.S. Trade Representative senior negotiator Ira Shapiro and Eisuke Sakakibara, director-general of the Japanese Finance Ministry's International Finance Bureau.
The U.S. official said the two sides were still exploring when and where further insurance talks would be held and whether or not they would include senior negotiators.
Efforts to resolve the dispute by July 31 failed after a round of marathon negotiations in Vancouver, British Columbia, ended with no agreement.
"This is a very difficult negotiation," the U.S. official said. "The changes we are seeking are significant changes."
